metadata.title: USN-3853-1 -- GnuPG vulnerability
metadata.description: Ben Fuhrmannek discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled Web Key Directory lookups. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service, or perform Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3853-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  dirmngr - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpgv-static - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpgv-win32 - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 scdaemon - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpgsm - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpgv - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpg - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gnupg-agent - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gnupg2 - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpgconf - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpgv-udeb - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpg-wks-client - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpg-wks-server - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpg-agent - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gnupg - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gnupg-utils - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gnupg-l10n - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 gpgv2 - 2.2.4-1ubuntu1.2 No subscription required
